Faculty Coordinator, Mathematics

Company Name Wesley College Company Location 5 Gladstone Parade, Elsternwick, VIC 3185, AU

New Posted Date Posted 22 minutes ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Wesley College Melbourne, a Uniting Church school with a rich tradition spanning 152 years, is a diverse, dynamic, coeducational learning community with more than 3,350 students aged between 3 and 18 years across three main campuses.

Applications are invited from innovative and engaging Mathematics (Years 7-9) teachers for a part-time (0.80 FTE) ongoing position at our Elsternwick campus commencing January 2019.

This position includes a leadership opportunity, as the Faculty Coordinator, Mathematics.

The Faculty Coordinator role is a significant curriculum leadership and management role that operates at campus level. Working in collaborative partnership with the relevant Head of Faculty (HOF), the Faculty Coordinator is expected to display leadership in delivery of the written, taught and assessed curriculum delivery for the disciplines within the faculty. The Faculty Coordinator has responsibility for coordinating curriculum and assessment planning activities, processes and procedures within the faculty to ensure effective curriculum delivery, enhancement of student learning and compliance with external requirements.

Faculty Coordinators at Elsternwick will work with guidance and directions from the relevant Head of Faculty at St Kilda Road.

The position requires an outstanding educator with some knowledge or experience of the International Baccalaureate Middle Years Programme (MYP) and a belief in inquiry practice. Teaching would be across Years 7 to 9. Demonstrated competence with technology and ICT to enhance the educational program is strongly desirable and experience in a similar setting would be well regarded.

Applications close at 5.00pm on 26 October 2018.

Please note that applications will be considered upon arrival and that interviews may commence prior to the closing date.

Wesley College is a child safe employer and is committed to the welfare of children and their protection. All potential employees and volunteers will be required to comply with the School's Child Safe Policy and Code of Conduct. Applicants will be required to undergo police and background checks in accordance with this policy.

Business Services Manager

Company Name Conquest Services Company Location Level 5 256 Queen Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The opportunity:

As a Business Services Manager at Conquest Services you will be working with a high-performance team in taxation advisory, business structuring, corporate compliance and management consulting. You will be the first point of contact dealing directly with our clients, allowing you to continuously develop your interpersonal and advisory skills which will allow you to step up to the role of Partner over the long term.

\xa0

You’ll be in charge of supervising, managing, reviewing and mentoring a team of (really great!) accountants and an outstanding client base. Over time you’ll grow to be in charge of approximately $1.2 million fee base of high-end clients – which will require great relationship management skills and a fantastic attention to detail. This opportunity offers a very structured and realistic path to Partnership without the need to develop your networks from scratch.


You will be encouraged to provide high-level advisory services to clients and will report directly into one of Conquest Services’ Partners who will mentor you through your progression in the firm. You will need to take initiative, and possess exceptional management skills to lead, coach and develop your team whilst refining your own leadership skills as you grow and develop on the Pathway to becoming a Partner. Cultural fit is incredibly important to our Conquest Team, and finding someone on the same page who is also as motivated to achieve outstanding results for our clients is a priority for us.

\xa0

Overview of the role:


  • Management of workflow
  • Management and preparation of tax compliance work (financial statements, income tax returns, BAS/IAS, FBT returns, payroll tax etc)
  • Management and mentoring of more junior staff
  • Management of staff training in collaboration with the Partners
  • Liaising with the ATO and other regulatory agencies on behalf of clients
  • Working with a range of entities including companies, trusts, partnerships, sole traders and super funds

\xa0

What we’re looking for:


The successful candidate will be ambitious, hardworking, diligent and have a high attention to detail.

Additionally, we are looking for that special person with

  • Minimum 8 years of experience working in a fast-paced Business Services/public practice firm;
  • Experience managing 3-5 staff
  • Be a Qualified Accountant, either CA or CPA;
  • Comprehensive knowledge of the Australian tax system
  • Strong analytical and advisory skills;
  • Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills;
  • Committed to proving exceptional client experiences
  • Excellent technical ability with Division 7A, tax planning, PSI, Trust issues, GST and CGT;

\xa0


Our offer to you:

\xa0

This is your opportunity to join Conquest Services, a firm that cares deeply for its staff and promotes a workplace where you’re able to grow and develop your skills while being exposed to incredible client experiences that will shape you as a professional. We work collaboratively, and believe that our team members are the heart and soul of our business. We value our team member contributions, and recognise and reward their efforts to provide a fun, satisfying and progressive workplace. With in house training twice a month, structured career pathways and succession planning and great social activities including monthly drinks, annual retreats and various team building activities throughout the year – Conquest Services is a holistic firm that always puts their team first.

\xa0

If you’re interested in taking up this opportunity to work with large international brands that offer you a chance to step up your career in the near future and the long-term, this is your chance.

\xa0

Please apply below by attaching your resume. If you’ve got any questions about the role – please don’t hesitate to reach out to Victoria Devine on 03 9603 8600 or at victoria@conquestservices.com.au\xa0

What we offer

About us

Jemena is an Australian energy company that owns and operates a diverse portfolio of electricity, gas and water transportation assets across the east coast of Australia. We supply millions of households and businesses with these essential services every day.

About the role

This is your opportunity to join Jemena as the Corporate Secretariat Administrator.

The role is important to a success of the Corporate Secretariat Team, in achieving high standards in corporate governance and compliance, by providing timely and practical Corporate Secretariat support to the Board and the business.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • maintaining corporate registers and data files,
  • collation, preparation and distribution of board submissions and circular resolutions,
  • coordination of board cycles and calendars,
  • coordinating Australian Securities & Investments Commission compliance,
  • assisting with the coordination of the portfolio of group companies, and
  • drafting corporate secretariat documentation as required.

What we’re looking for

As the successful candidate you will bring the following experience and competencies with you:

  • Qualifications in Applied Corporate Governance, preferred, with considerable corporate secretarial and governance experience in a similar role,
  • Excellent abilities in organising and planning arranging meetings, maintaining files and a demonstrated understanding of office/administrative procedures,
  • Excellent business skills with the ability to draft, proof and edit documents and minutes, with demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy,
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact across all levels of business management,
  • Able to lead and take initiative, working both autonomously and as part of a team.
  • Adaptable mindset to be able to follow process but be flexible to respond to situations calmly,
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality,

Jemena is a dynamic company that focuses on attracting and motivating talented industry professionals. We have made it our priority to create an exceptional workplace with competitive salaries, educational assistance and salary packaging options, among other benefits.

917946834:
[

Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgeon: Cerebral Palsy Clinical Lead and Gait Lab Clinical Director

Company Name The Royal Children's Hospital Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Royal Children's Hospital (RCH) Melbourne is one of the world's great children's hospitals. We are the major specialist paediatric hospital in Victoria and our care extends to children from Tasmania, southern New South Wales and other states around Australia and overseas.

With a passionate, highly skilled and committed staff campus wide of over 4500, we provide a full range of clinical services, tertiary care and health promotion and prevention programs for children and young people. The Royal Children’s Hospital is committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people. For further information on our Commitment to Child Safety go to: http://www.rch.org.au/quality/child-safety/

The RCH provides world class facilities for staff, patients and families, making it an exciting place to work and progress your career. We offer a competitive salary and salary packaging options along with interesting and varied work.

The Role

An experienced Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgeon with sub-specialty interest and experience in the management of Cerebral Palsy, Movement disorders and Gait laboratory.

The Paediatric Orthopaedic Department is a large department within RCH caring for all aspects of musculoskeletal disorders in children. The team consists of 15 surgeons organised into smaller sub-teams. The CP service is supported by a Physiotherapist who co-ordinates Hip Surveillance and by a Clinical Nurse Specialist, who co-ordinates outpatient and surgical services. The Hugh Williamson Gait Laboratory is a world-renowned state of the art facility providing high quality motion capture 3-D analysis of gait disorders. It has a dedicated staff of engineers. Physiotherapists, and clerical staff.

The purpose of the appointment is to provide specialised paediatric orthopaedic care for children with all levels of disability associated with Cerebral Palsy and related neuromuscular disorders.

You Will Be Responsible For
  • Providing leadership to the team of Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgeons looking after CP and related disorders
  • The provision of high quality care (surgery and consultative) for children with CP and general orthopaedic conditions, including trauma
  • Acting as the Clinical Director of the gait laboratory working together with the gait laboratory manager to provide a clinical gait analysis service to support the CP team.
  • Working with and training biomedical engineers, Allied Health personnel, Fellows and Registrars, and medical students in gait analysis. This includes conducting a biennial course in clinical gait analysis with the gait laboratory manager and team.
  • Working as part of a team of orthopaedic surgeons to take a role in the education of Residents, Registrars and Fellows.
  • Leading audit, quality control and comprehensive outcomes studies


You Will Have
  • Completed an approved training program in Orthopaedic Surgery
  • Completed of an approved Fellowship in Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgery
  • Qualified as a medical practitioner registrable with the Medical Practitioners Board of Victoria
  • A Fellowship qualifications with the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons (or equivalent)
  • General or Specific Medical Registration with AHPRA
  • Substantial experience in Motion Capture 3-Dimensional Gait Analysis: technical features, interpretation and reporting
  • Substantial experience in the Operative and Non-Operative Management of Non-ambulant and Ambulant Cerebral Palsy patients
  • A track record of published research in the cerebral palsy/neuromuscular area.

Industry

  • Hospital & Health Care

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Health Care Provider

Kids First Australia (formerly known as Children's Protection Society) have an exciting opportunity available in a leadership role within a new multidisciplinary Hub to deliver high quality, safe and effective responses, in partnership with Family Safety Victoria (FSV).


The vision for the Hubs is to create a future where all Victorians can enjoy safe and respectful personal and family relationships, where children grow up in families that value their health, development and wellbeing. The Support & Safety Hubs will deliver a fundamental change to the way we work with women, children, families, and the perpetrators of violence.

A satisfactory police check, clear Working with Child Check and a current Victorian Driver's License are required.

919266003:
[

Cyber Security Manager

Company Name MYOB Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Cyber Security Manager – Glen Waverley / Richmond

Who are we

We are a leading tech company that exists to help businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe businesses can do amazing things and it's our job to help them. This is MYOB.

The opportunity

We have an exciting position available for a Cyber Security Manager to undertake a key leadership role across MYOB’s information and cyber security eco-system. You will join a growing team of security specialists across the business. You will be integral to supporting and guiding this multi-skilled community of practice, as we continue to stay ahead of the curve in an evolving and increasingly complex security threat landscape.

Security plays a pivotal role at MYOB and runs deep inside the DNA of the way we interact with technology. The role offers great opportunity to make a real difference on how security can be nurtured and strategically positioned to not only protect MYOB’s technical assets, critical data, people and importantly our clients.

The role
  • Support the Head of Group ICT Services in maintaining and executing MYOB's overall enterprise-wide Information & Cyber Security strategy and plans including championing group wide security related initiatives, investments and innovations.
  • In collaboration with the Head of Group ICT Services, lead the enterprise-wide information and cyber security function (including incident response) from a governance, risk and compliance perspective.
  • Drive awareness and adoption of the desired cyber security culture and behaviours across MYOB’s employee community.Directly manage the internal ICT security function to ensure the secure delivery of corporate IT services to MYOB’s clients and staff and minimise of the risk of data breaches of both MYOB and client data.

What You Will Bring
  • A big-picture thinker with and a solid appreciation of how information technology and security, supports, protects and enables the business over a strategic scope and timescale.
  • Experience leading a comparable enterprise-wide information and cyber security function including a demonstrated ability to transform and/or uplift organisational cyber security culture and maturity.
  • Strong security focussed operational and/or compliance risk knowledge and experience with an understanding of both technological trends and developments and risk control frameworks such as COBiT, ISO 27001, ITIL, PCI-DSS.

What Else Do You Need To Know

You will be supported by the Head of Group ICT Services, our exec level Information Security governance group and security specialists across our product engineering and corporate ICT teams. We will work with you to shape the role to build on your strengths and interests. You will have access to MYOB’s award-winning Learning Lab talent development program, as well as formal and informal professional development opportunities.

MYOB has an empowering and supportive culture. You will be part of a high performing, collaborative team who take their work seriously but not themselves. If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued and your ideas can make a difference, you should work at MYOB. We are an equal opportunity employer who values diversity and supports flexible work arrangements.

The role will be notionally based in MYOB’s purpose-built Glen Waverley office. We also have a recently expanded Richmond office and there is flexibility to also work from that location. Our Melbourne operations will be consolidated into a new, state of the art Richmond office in 2020.

So it is over to you, do you want to Love Your Work? Find out more by applying now. We look forward to meeting you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

Industry

Full-time

  • Information Technology

Company Name ACCIONA Geotech Company Location Melton, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Coleman Rail is a specialist rail infrastructure contractor experienced in delivering both light and heavy rail construction and maintenance projects across brownfield and greenfield environments.\xa0


An integral part of the ACCIONA group of companies in Australia, Coleman Rail boosts ACCIONA offering across the rail sector allowing us to undertake the design & construction of almost all of the individual components that collectively make up the fixed rail infrastructure of a rail network.


National operations see Coleman Rail currently engaged in two major Victorian partnerships for the delivery of major government funded alliance programs one of which is The Ballarat Line Upgrade (BLU). This project will be delivering extensive upgrade works to the regional Victorian rail corridor involving: passing loop construction, station upgrades and substantial road/rail interface upgrades, and various works for platforms, stabling lines, passing loops & carparks.

\xa0

The Planner reports to the Construction Manager and provides planning for BLU in line with contractual requirements to ensure a robust connection between the plans of the Alliance and the schedule. As the Senior Planner, you would be required to be proactive during the development of staging plans and other planning outputs. Lead on ensuring the effective translation of the project team’s collective planning into a useful and useable schedule. Ensure consistent schedule integrity/quality, implement progress-monitoring tools, assist the CM in understanding risks to the program, understand, and monitor internal and external interfaces. You will need:

\xa0

  • Engineering degree, or equivalent

  • Member of the Australian Institute of Project Management

  • PRINCE2 qualification desirable

  • Substantial experience in rail or civil construction, both in delivery and planning roles

  • Rail Industry Worker (RIW) Card, with appropriate training, inductions, competencies, roles and medical to perform your duties, ensuring this card is current at all times

  • Current Driver Licence and your own reliable vehicle.

\xa0

At Coleman Rail, we can offer you:

A competitive salary and salary packaging, solid support and training and a dedicated team on an exciting major project.

\xa0

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and promote equality and diversity. Indigenous Australians and candidates from minority groups are encouraged to apply.

Job description

  • Melbourne CBD Location
  • National Professional Services Firm

About Us

RSM is the 6th largest network of independent audit, tax and consulting firms, encompassing over 120 countries, 800 offices and more than 43,000 people internationally. We have 30 offices throughout Australia and offer personalised services with in-depth expertise and resources in the accountancy, business consulting and risk management areas.

The Opportunity

Our Melbourne Assurance and Advisory team is seeking an experienced and self-motivated Assistant Manager. It is a key requirement you can produce high quality written advice and reports, in addition to a well-developed capability to think laterally.

This role will see you working with a diverse range clients and stakeholders including public listed, not for profit and government clients. Your main duties will include managing a portfolio of clients through planning, delivering and reporting on their audit requirements as well as supporting more junior team members.

Key Responsibilities Include
  • Conduct various audit engagements simultaneously with numerous engagement team members per audit, including planning, execution and scheduling staff;
  • Summarises the key areas of the engagement for the partner;
  • Identifies potential technical issues and documenting issue and proposed solution for partner attention;
  • Drafts management letters in conjunction with manager and partner that provide practical and commercial business advice;
  • Identifies and refers ethical, accounting and conflict issues to manager and/or partner;
  • Assists partners and managers in sales and marketing activities; and
  • Contributes to meetings and is able to make effective presentations.
The Successful Applicant

To be considered for this role you must be able to demonstrate the following:
  • Qualified as a Chartered Accountant;
  • 5+ years in a similar role within professional services;
  • Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written);
  • Demonstrated leadership, coaching, analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Advanced computer skills using Microsoft Products and audit software;
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team;
  • Strong organisational and time managements skills;
  • Ability to build rapport with a variety of clients and colleagues;
  • Commitment to delivering exceptional client service; and
  • CaseWare experience (desirable).
What's on Offer

In this role you will be working within a national Firm and be mentored by experienced Audit practitioners. You will have direct access to and work closely with the Audit Partners and a wide variety of clients and assignments.

RSM provides our employees with the opportunity to connect for success through our culture, employee benefits and an environment that supports work life balance. On offer is a competitive opportunity for personal and professional development and a friendly and supportive environment.

Job description

  • Work close to home for an iconic Australian company
  • Family-friendly company; great team culture; on-site health club; employee benefits
  • Full-time position

\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

Jayco is the largest manufacturer of recreational vehicles in Australasia. Due to continued growth, we are currently seeking a full-time permanent qualified and competent Industrial Engineer to work at our Head Office production facility\xa0in Dandenong South.


This role offers an outstanding opportunity for an energetic and results driven engineer to join our team. In this role, the successful applicant will be working towards continuous improvement by contributing to the design of process flows and implementation of new processes to provide optimum performance with a focus on cost reduction, safety, quality, delivery and customer engagement.


The key duties of this position will include the following:

  • Evaluate existing manufacturing processes and workflows to identify areas that could benefit from changes and improvements.

  • Develop and prepare reports, flow diagrams and charts to track and enhance production efficiency.

  • Work with the Production team to educate, drive and champion adherence to new, lean manufacturing processes.

  • Develop standardised processes across all product lines.

  • Lead and manage change processes initiatives.

  • Facilitate training and education of change process programs on a large scale.

  • Conduct time studies of labour and processes to improve efficiency.

  • Track, update and report on key projects and activities using project management software.

    \xa0

The successful candidate should have the following skills:

  • Tertiary Qualification in Manufacturing Engineering.

  • Proven background and experience in manufacturing.

  • Solid experience in Lean methodologies.

  • Experience in creating and implementing efficiency enhancements to generate cost reduction.

  • Analytical skills and experience with problem-solving tools.

Job description

The Cr\xe9dit Agricole CIB Group

This role is an opportunity to work for Credit Agricole CIB Australia Limited (CACIB) in Melbourne. CACIB Australia is a 100% owned finance subsidiary of Cr\xe9dit Agricole CIB and has been operating in Australia for over 35 years. Cr\xe9dit Agricole CIB is the corporate and investment banking arm of the Credit Agricole Group and a market leader in structured finance supporting clients in major international markets through a global network linking the main countries in Europe, North and South America, Asia and the Middle East. The Credit Agricole Group is one of the top ten banks globally by assets (The Banker - July 2018) and retains a strong “A” rating (positive outlook) from Standard & Poors.


Job Description


The Real Estate Finance team of CACIB has been financing institutional real estate in the Australian & New Zealand markets continually for the past 30 years. The team provides financing, hedging, debt capital markets and advisory services across the Office, Retail, Industrial, Hotels and Residential sectors. Our clients include local and global property groups, REITs and large / high net worth privates. \xa0

The current team comprises some 4 officers across various levels of seniority with the support of middle office and other functions. The new role will be based in Melbourne as a Senior member of the Real Estate Finance team in Australia. Principal functions will include: \xa0

  • client relationship management;

  • marketing and deal identification / origination;

  • transaction analysis (financial & risk), structuring and execution (including documentation) of transactions;

  • business line and credit submissions and processes;

  • portfolio / risk management;

  • financial & management reporting, budgets and strategy;

  • compliance & regulatory requirements;

    • cross-sell product initiatives; and responsibility for and/or assistance on various projects within the Real Estate team \xa0and CACIB

    \xa0

    Personal Attributes

    • At least 10 years + experience in real estate finance or a similar area within a financial institution in Australia;

    • Experience in originating, analyzing and executing structured Real Estate financing transactions in Australia;

    • The ability to work autonomously and provide supervision of others where appropriate;

    • The capacity to work together in a small team and have the flexibility to multi-task and work under time pressure whilst maintaining attention to detail;

    • Be self-motivated and have exceptional communication (verbal & written) and presentation skills;

    • Academic qualifications in a real estate and/or finance related discipline essential.

      An attractive compensation package will be provided commensurate with the experience and skill base of the successful applicant.


      To enquire further about this excellent opportunity please apply via the below link and provide your resume and a cover letter outlining your previous experience and how it will benefit this new role.

917882879:
[

Software Development Engineer

Company Name Polyglot Group Company Location Rowville

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 56 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

You don’t need a Silicon Valley office and all that startup swag.

Though, what you need is an environment where people write quality software and a place where people solve some serious problems.

How about this: Your software will create better outcomes for people with chronic and complex health conditions. You’ll help patients and physician receive the results quicker and healthcare professionals feel confident that they are getting the usability, safety and accuracy they need.

We’re assisting a medical diagnostics manufacturer to find them a Software Development Engineer that can help them build complex medical products for a global giant with a household name. You’ll join a team of 6 SDEs that have built 60% of the software, with the remaining 40% to be completed over the next 1-2 years.

In an ideal world, your profile looks a bit like this:

- 5 years’ experience in C++ / OOP in an embedded Linux environment
- Ability to code major/complex components
- Experience in implementing and debugging Linux kernel drivers
- Experienced in extending u-boot for custom target platforms; independently configure and extend u-boot
- Solid understanding of networking and web security

Some of the desirable skills:

- Experience in Web development in C++; creating web servers in C++ that are hosted in embedded firmware
- Mobile App development experience (Android/iOS), including Bluetooth connectivity
- Understanding of IEC 62304 (medical device software – software life cycle processes)
- Ability to create FDA (Food & Drug Administration) / TGA (Therapeutic Goods Administration) standard software development documents
- QT framework
- Experience in CI, using Jenkins
- Previous experience with Yocto Linux (or similar distribution)

They’re also open to talking to smart and curious Junior SDEs that have an eye for code clarity, get satisfaction in creating robust and safe software and are strong learners.

Job benefits and perks:

- You’ll join a team of quality software engineers and work on extremely complex problems
- $80k-110k + Super with additional share options and yearly team bonus
- South East Melbourne (Mulgrave – Dandenong area)
- On-site parking, accessible via public transport
- Working hours: 9 to 5, however, they’re flexible around those times
- A friendly and respectful workplace

This is a 12-month contract with the strong possibility to be extended.

Straight-forward recruitment process: First interview with us, second interview with them where you’ll meet your manager, some of your co-workers and their HR director.

If this sounds like a challenge you’re ready to take up and are interested in discussing further, please click “apply”.


Desired Skills and Experience

New Business Development Manager

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 94 views

Job description

Who are we?

We are Coca-Cola Amatil, the power behind our region’s favourite brands. Our huge portfolio includes much-loved brands such as Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta, Deep Spring, Kirks, Mount Franklin, Pump, Powerade, Barista Bros and Zico Coconut Water.

The Role

We are looking for an enthusiastic and driven New Business Development Manager to join our Immediate Consumption channel within Victoria.

In this role you will identify and convert new business opportunities that deliver long term growth and brand recognition across the state for our sensational portfolio of brands.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Achieving new business wins within the immediate consumption channel
  • Grow profitable, long term volume within new business throughout the State
  • Collaborate with wider Amatil business to explore new business opportunities.
  • Develop networks across the industry and customer base
  • Manage and demonstrate ‘Pipeline’ management of long and short-term opportunities
  • Negotiate new business contracts/ tenders in line with business process

About You

You will be a go-getter with a great attitude. You will love meeting people, understanding customer ‘s needs and closing agreements. You will also enjoy working with a collaborative team and be able to manage pipelines and work towards targets. Your confidence and tenacious approach, together with high integrity and resilience will ensure you succeed.

To be successful in this role you will also be able to demonstrate:

  • Strong track record in face to face sales, converting leads and winning new business
  • Exceptional negotiation skills and ability to influence at all levels- prior experience negotiating contracts, tenders and service agreements
  • Exemplary planning and organisational skills, the ability to plan ahead and reach goals as well deadlines
  • Able to demonstrate a high level of initiative and entrepreneurship to drive business results
  • Be skilled at developing exceptional business relationships with customers and internal stakeholders across the Amatil business
  • Commercially and financially astute and ability to develop compelling business proposals.

What’s in it for you?

Working at Coca-Cola Amatil is unlike any other career experience. We offer an attractive salary package including fully maintained vehicle, iPhone and iPad. On top of this we offer a range of employee benefits including retail discounts, discounted gym memberships, staff sampling which includes alcohol and much much more!

We value the importance of career growth and progression. We will invest in your training and development that will set you up for future success.

If you are interested in this role, please submit your resume online.
